basics.name: Mckenna Cisler
basics.label: Computer Scientist
basics.summary: I'm a second-year student who enjoys programming in all its forms. My interests are still developing but I'm very interested in large information systems, networking, and big data.

work.summary: HCRI is an interdisciplinary coalition dedicated to researching and developing humanity-centered robotics. I worked as a technician on robots involved in research, development projects, and demonstrations. I also work on some pilot projects in humanity-centered robot design.
highlights: Worked on hardware interfacing and user interaction design for “Tablebot” – a novel mobile telepresence robot designed to resemble furniture
Co-developed node.js & NodeMCU-based wireless trash can monitoring system for Brown University Facilities Department
Set up various ROS-based robots, including the TurtleBot and MIT’s DuckieBot self-driving car
Worked on Raspberry Pi and OpenCV-based dice-reading randomness generator

work.summary: A company interested in promoting STEM learning through instructional camps and development of education resources. I worked as a developer of various educational tools and demos for use in our camps and to be sold to local teachers and schools, and also as an instructor for educational children's camps.
highlights: Developed an ATtiny85-based “paper circuit” controller to be sold to educators, including documentation, manufacturing, and marketing materials
Developed, assembled and demoed educational tools and resources, including IoT devices, ScratchX extensions, wireless 3D printing tools, and a Raspberry Pi-based Sphero programming interface
Planned and ran weeklong STEAM workshops for 3rd – 9th graders

work.summary: Brown Space Engineering is a club at Brown University dedicated to making space flight more accessible. It hopes to achieve this by launching a fully open-source CubeSet in Q2 2018 capable of being reproduced for ~$5000 in under a year.
highlights: Wrote RTOS tasks in C for multi-frequency data recording and transmission packaging
Co-designed data collection structures and transmission schema
Worked on boot sequence and satellite state handling systems

courses: CSCI 0190 - Advanced Introduction to Computer Science
CSCI 0220 - Introduction to Discrete Structures and Probability

projects.name: Wikispeedia
projects.description: Webapp frontend for the Wikipedia Game
highlights: Worked on websocket communication framework, Wikipedia crawling and caching, and dynamic generation of page pairs

projects.name: The Social Playlist
projects.description: Music queue web app for crowd-sourced playlists

projects.name: Hubway Maps
projects.description: Visualization of socioeconomic data on Hubway stations in Cambridge, MA

projects.name: AlarmPi (individual)
projects.description: Raspberry Pi-based alarm clock with configuration interface
highlights: Python Tornado backend for responsive configuration & alarm-setting web interface
